data.title: The Sparrow by Mary Doria Russell
data.meta_description: The Sparrow: Mary Doria Russell by Russell, Mary Doria and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Condition: Good. SHIPS FROM USA. Used books have different signs of use and do not include supplemental materials such as CDs, Dvds, Access Codes, charts or any other extra material. All used books might have various degrees of writing, highliting and wear and tear and possibly be an ex-library with the usual stickers and stamps. Dust Jackets are not guaranteed and when still present, they will have various degrees of tear and damage. All images are Stock Photos, not of the actual item. book.

Ex-library, octavo softcover (VG-); all our specials have minimal description to keep listing them viable. They are at least reading copies, complete and in reasonable condition, but usually secondhand; frequently they are superior examples. Ordering more than one book may reduce your overall postage costs.

Audio Book (CD). Condition: used. A visionary work that combines speculative fiction with deep philosophical inquiry, The Sparrow tells the story of a charismatic Jesuit priest and linguist, Emilio Sandoz, who leads a scientific mission entrusted with a profound task: to make first contact with intelligent extraterrestrial life. The mission begins in faith, hope, and beauty, but a series of small misunderstandings brings it to a catastrophic end.Praise for The SparrowA startling, engrossing, and moral work of fiction.-The New York Times Book ReviewImportant novels leave deep cracks in our beliefs, our prejudices, and our blinders. The Sparrow is one of them.-Entertainment WeeklyPowerful . . . The Sparrow tackles a difficult subject with grace and intelligence.-San Francisco ChronicleProvocative, challenging . . . recalls both Arthur C. Clarke and H. G. Wells, with a dash of Ray Bradbury for good measure.-The Dallas Morning News[Mary Doria] Russell shows herself to be a skillful storyteller who subtly and expertly builds suspense.-USA Today.

Trade paperback. The author's justifiably highly acclaimed first book, winner of 3 science fiction awards, and in its story of man's encounter with intelligent beings on another planet, one of the most thought-provoking works of speculative fiction published in recent years. Basis of the (perpetually) forth-coming movie. The sequel, Children of God, was nominated for the Hugo. 408 pp plus a reader's guide. Near fine in glossy illustrated wrappers.

Soft cover. Condition: Very Good. Giottto di Bodone, dj art. (illustrator). 1st Edition. This book in pictorial wraps is an Uncorrected Proof of the Hardcover First Edition. The book has light wear to the covers and light tanning and light wear to the page block. 2 4 6 8 9 7 5 3 First Edition number line. Signed by the author on the title page. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. First edition, first printing. This copy has the two correct issue points: 1) "code 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2/First Edition" on copyright page and 2)"two feet per second,." at the beginning of page 95, line ten. Small remainder dot on top of page block, else very fine in very fine dust jacket.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. 1st Edition. Hardcover, with DJ. Good condition. Blue paper over boards with black paper and gold lettering to the spine. Blue and brown illustrated dust jacket with gold and black lettering. No date on title page. Dated 1996 on copyright page. Stated first edition. Number line is complete. This publisher uses 2 as the first printing indicator, so it appears to be a second printing. It is a first printing. Photographer's name on dust jacket should read, "Rossi", but is misprinted as "Ross". 408 pages. Binding is strong and square. General light rubbing to the covers. Corners very lightly worn. Spine bumped. Pages clean and free of mars throughout. Some light discoloration and smudging to the page edges. Dust jacket has been wrapped in a protective mylar cover. Head of the spine is very lightly wrinkled. No other creases or tears. Overall good condition. Please email with questions or to see any photos.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. First Edition/ First Printing with the complete number line: "98765432" is one of this copy's issue points. This Fine book is housed in a Fine dust jacket and contains the proper first edition issue points including the number line and"Thirty-two feet per second" on pg.95 line 10. This as new unread book that is tight and bright, with no remainder marks, is not price clipped, and is not ex-library. Housed in a mylar and shipped carefully wrapped and in a sturdy box.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition, First Printing. First edition, first printing hardcover signed by the author, with all first issue points present. Unclipped plastic covered dust jacket, page block face is rough cut, and remainder mark to page block head. Page block is lightly blemished, and spine ends slightly bumped. Otherwise, as unread. LW. Signed by Author. Used.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. 1st Edition. The edge's of the page block are slightly dusty and there is a small remainder dot to the bottom of the page block. The dust jacket has light wear to the extremities, a 1/4" closed tear to the top of the spine, and is unclipped ($23.00). 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 number line. Signed by the author on the title page. This book has the correct First Edition points. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. The book has a small, light stain to the bottom of the page block. The dust has slight soiling to the covers and jacket is unclipped ($23.00). 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 number line. Signed by the author on the title page. This book has the correct First Edition points. Signed by Author(s).

Hardcover. Condition: New. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. True first edition with "karstic" on page 16. SIGNED label by author laid in. Hardcover book & DJ in NEW Fine excellent condition. FIRST EDITION FIRST PRINTING. Bright clean ,tight crisp. Faint remainder mark. Not exlibrary, no underlining,no margin notes, not price clipped.Not a book club.Corners not bent. Shelf 1058. Signed by Author(s).
